title: Simulation-Based Lumbar Puncture Technique Training: Conceptual and Procedural Integrated Pedagogy Application

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Terminology Comprehension and Fundamental Knowledge of Simple Medical Procedures
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment combining real-time video lectures with simulation tools in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) setting.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five core stages of the lumbar puncture procedure with 90% accuracy.
Learners can provide three or more justifications for procedural decisions based on the correlation between anatomical structures and clinical symptoms.
Learners can reproduce lumbar puncture techniques in a simulation environment with a performance standard of over 80%.
Learners can integrate conceptual knowledge into procedural applications and transfer it to new scenarios with over 70% effectiveness.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
